intro: Haloragis milesiae, commonly known as the New Zealand starfruit, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Haloragaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Haloragis milesiae is adapted to temperate climates and is often found in regions with high humidity.
